Line: Episode 317
By Brad Wright Alien Planet. Two moons can be seen in the sky. SG-1 is sitting with a native woman on a hillside over looking a large body of water at night.
"So, Laira, When's the big show gonna start?"
"Soon, be patient."
"Oh, I'm patient. I'm nothing if not patient. When's it start?"
"Is he always like this?"
"Quite frequently."
"Thank you, Teal'c."
"Laira, we haven't seen anything you could call "fire rain" these past few nights...how come you're sure it's gonna to fall tonight?"
"It begins this night each year."
"Whoa...the same night every year? That doesn't make sense...I mean unless the planet's orbit travels through a debris field like an asteroid belt, in which case..."
"Please...don't suck the fun out of this..."
"Sorry, sir."
"When I was a child, my father told me that the fire rain was the tears of our ancestors longing to be reunited."
"On Chulak we call it Tal Pak Ryn."
"Which means, uh...falling star."
"What do you think, Jack? Was it worth the effort?"
"Oh, yeah,...yeah, I'm a huge fan of fireworks."
"Whoa...Carter, how close was that?"
"Close, sir."
"How big?"
"Big."
"Thought so."
"Laira, that's what we call a near miss. If that meteor had struck the ground instead of bouncing off of the atmosphere...."
"This...is an annual event?"
"Yes, though it grows more spectacular every year. By tomorrow evening the entire sky..." "What's wrong?"
"I'll make some more observations tonight, sir."
"I'm gonna check the, uh, geological record in the morning..."
"I'll...make a wish."

"See this bright dot? It represents your world, Edora. Now it orbits your sun in a big circle like this and crosses through an asteroid belt up here at it's widest point. Now, as you pass through the millions of tiny rocks and particles, some of them burn up in Edora's atmosphere..."
"As fire rain..."
"Exactly. The problem is, the asteroid belt isn't uniform, so certain orbits in certain years must pass through a denser debris field. Can you ever remember the fire rain striking the ground?"

"Not in my life time, nor in my father's...but there is a tale of the ancestors that on the second day of the fire rain, there was a distant thunder and the horizon burned as thought the sun never set."
"How long ago was that?"
"Many, many years ago."
"Mornin' campers. Who's goin' on Daniel's little geology field trip?"
"Garan?"
"Garan can show you the way to the caves. He and a young girl go there from time to time, though I don't know why."
"Mother!"
"Fair day, and be well."
"Sir, I'd like to go back to Earth and input the data I collected from last night's observations into the base's mainframe."
"Go ahead."
"Fair day, Laira."
"Fair day."
"I'm sure you'll want to discuss the treaty ...between our two worlds."
"Sure...we could do that..."
Inside the Edoran caves.
"What's Naquada?"
"Cool...uh, J..Jack, says that."
"Yes, he does. I'm not really sure that, uh, cool applies to this. You see, something like this happened on my world millions of years ago and nearly wiped out all life."
"That's what's gonna happen here?"
"Well, we only know that it has happened...uh, in varying degrees of destruction every 150 years or so..."
"And it appears that is precisely the amount of time since the last impact." "I see no reason to withhold the truth from these people, Daniel Jackson."
"Is there anything we can do to stop it?"
"No."

According to the observations I made last night, the near miss we experienced was just the first of hundreds of car-sized asteroids directly in the path of Edora - P5C-768. The night sky is full of them.
"We can't evacuate an entire planet, Major."

"As far as we know, these are the only descendents of a race brought to Edora by the Goa'uld thousands of years ago. There may only be a small number of strikes locally. If that's the case, we can send them home in a few days. If not, we'd be saving the last of a people, sir."
Edora - Jack and Laira are walking over a bridge approaching a man who is pulling traps out of the water.
"Paynan...this is Jack."
"They say you've come through the stone ring. Hard thing to ask a man to believe."
"There's nothing more than meets the eye here...our fields...those few buildings...our children...what we have, we need."
"We're only interested in fair trade, sir."
"Many of my people are most curious to know what it is we have that you could possibly want."
"Well, you remember how excited Carter got the day we got here?"
"Something in our soil..."
"That's a mineral called Naquada. We don't have it on Earth...it's...well, it's very important to us."
"Why?"
"It's powerful."
"And in return for taking this Naquada from our soil?"
"Well, there are a lot of things we could help you out with...medicine, technology, education...we'd become friends."
"We're already friends."
"Closer friends?"
"My mother taught me to be wary of men wishing to be closer friends."
"Well, if you'd like, I'll negotiate this treaty with your mother, that way there'd be no conflict of interest..."
"I've never seen the fire rain in the light of day."
Edoran Caves Daniel is picking up an artifact.
"It's a cooking utensil. Which probably means at some point a number of people spent time here."
"Perhaps this cave provided a means for a small number of Edorans to survive the last meteor bombardment."
"The ancestors."
Edoran Village
"There is no threat."
"If just one big meteor lands within a few miles of here, the resulting explosion could wipe out the entire village."
"Year after year, the fire rain comes, goes and harms no one. Do you not see what they are doing? They want us gone so they can claim our lands for themselves."
"That's not true."
"If you go with them, you will never see your land again."
"Oh, for cryin' out loud, there's always one like you in a crowd. You wanna stay...stay."
"You need only take what you can carry. There'll be plenty of food and water where we're going."
"All right folks, train's leavin'...let's move."
Laira's house - as she is packing.
"Garan...don't forget the prayer chain that you're father gave you. Garan?" "Oh, no."
"Have you seen Garan?"
"Daniel, Teal'c...Garan come back with you?"
"He should be here, O'Neill."
"The cave...we were talking about how previous generations survived, they must have...gone back there."
"All right, you three go...get these people outta here...we'll find the kids and catch up."
"Sir?"
"Go!"
"SG-1's code, sir."
"Here they come, people. Doctor, stand by to receive refugees."
"Yes, sir."
Edora We see Jack and Laira running toward the caves. Next we see Daniel in front of the active Edoran gate helping people walk through.
"Don't be afraid, the others are waiting for you on the other side."
"How many?"
"Approximately one-third of the village."
"What?"
"You go through...let the Edorans know everything is all right. We'll be on your six." "Colonel...please respond."
Edoran Caves
"Garan! Naytha!"
"Mother! This is where the ancestors survived. We brought food...and some water..."
"Garan, try this my way..."
Edoran Stargate
"It's getting too dangerous, Teal'c."
"He can dial home when he gets here."
"We're losing wormhole stability."
"Colonel O'Neill went to help some villagers. We waited until the last possible moment, sir."
"General Hammond, I wish to return immediately with a search party."
"You can't Teal'c. That last hit was right on top of the 'gate, you'd be walking into a firestorm."
"I'm not willing to let you."
"We can wait 24 hours and send a M.A.L.P through, sir."
"Major Carter's right. If it's safe by tomorrow, you'll all go."
Edora Jack is looking out the mouth of the cave. Rain and ash are falling and he can see several fires in the distance as explosions continue.
"It's still pretty hot out there, we should stay put. There's good news...it's raining. It should put out some of the fires."
"Could you see the village?"
"No. Garan...we had a plan."
"Daniel said there's nothing you could do."
"Me too."
"Chevron six encoded."
"Chevron seven...locked. Wormhole established..."
"Thank God."
"Standing by for M.A.L.P. deployment, sir."
"Send it through."
"The M.A.L.P. should reach Edora in four, three, two, one...we should be receiving telemetry now, sir."
"No signal."
"Environmental reports no telemetry."
Communications...no telemetry.
"Then the M.A.L.P. must have been destroyed as soon as it reached the other side. There's no other explanation."

"Shut it down." "Until you can provide me with answers to this problem, the rescue mission is scrubbed." "Inform our visitors they'll be staying with us until we can make a proper assessment of your situation."
"Yes, sir."

Edoran Village - Smoke is rising all around and several of the buildings look burnt. Garan opens the door to Laira's house and finds several villagers in there. Many are injured and coughing. Soon Naytha, Laira and Jack follow.
"Paynan?"
"Laira."
"Why did you stay?"
"On the third day we could take no more...we fled to the stone ring...where it used to be..."
"Used to be?"
"It's gone. I'll never see my people again. They can never come home."
"Nope."
"And you..."
"Thanks be to the ancestors that we live and have a roof to shield our heads. Thanks be to the ancestors that we have food to sustain and nourish us."
"This is all that remains of our people because of you."
"My mother and father..."
"You took them away through that thing...and now it is gone."
"That thing probably saved their lives and if you'd have shut up and listened to me in the first place, this wouldn't be the situation."
"Thank you."
"No signal from the radio transmitter, sir."
"If the Edoran Stargate were truly buried, how then was a wormhole established?"
"The meteor hit while the wormhole was active."
"So, so?"
"So it's possible that the molten Naquada hardened just above the event horizon."
"Like an iris?"
"Yeah."
"Sergeant, shut it down."
"Yes, sir."
"That was our last shot, people. I'm calling this one. As of right now, I'm officially calling him missing in action."
"General Hammond, perhaps Edora can be reached by another means."
"That's right...the Tok'ra could send a ship..."
"Or, or the Tollan..."
"Let me at least contact those of our allies that are capable of interstellar travel...see if they're willing to help."
"Very well, Doctor."

Edora - Laira's house. Jack is lying on the floor. Laira comes around in front of him, wearing her nightgown and walks to the washbasin to wash her face. She notices Jack, who is awake and watching her. She picks up a shirt and hands it to Jack.
"There's a chance the Stargate is just buried..."
"We have to rebuild before the harvest and...there are very few of us now..."
"Wormhole physics...a field, Major, that you pioneered, states that under these conditions ordinary matter won't even reintegrate on the other side. There's no way to overcome that."
"Sokar?"
"Yes, sir. When he tried to breach the iris by bombarding it with a particle beam. Subatomic particles, barely small enough to reintegrate, produced energy as they decayed."
"Which caused the iris to heat up..."
"Exactly. Now, if we could do the same thing, we could melt the hardened Naquada barrier just above the event horizon and create a pocket of super-heated gas."
"Then what?"

"Well then all we have to do is open the 'gate again, sir. The unstable vortex it normally generates would then be allowed to expand into that pocket and create and even larger cavern. One person might be able to go through, sir, and dig it out."
"We don't have a particle beam generator, sir. We'd have to build one."
"Then you'd better get started."
Edora - where the Stargate used to be
"You, uh, missed evening meal. I brought you something."
"Wasn't hungry."
"Well, you gotta be...you worked all day in the fields."
"I've got a couple of hours of good light left."
"I'm sorry."
"For what?"
"You can't go home...it's my fault."
"No it's not."
"You working through the night again?"
"Yeah, Lot of work to do...thank you."
"Look Sam, there's no doubt you are going to solve this, but you have to accept the fact it's going to take time."
"Yeah, well, if I think that way, it could take months."
"Daniel says the Tollan could have a ship in the vicinity of Edora some time early next year."
"He shouldn't have to wait that long."
"You miss him."
'Yeah."
"Is this a problem?"
"No, No...Of course not."
"Okay...good night."
"Good night."
Edora Jack is throwing stones in a body of water. Laira approaches.
"Many of us fear the fire rain will come again. Do you?"
"No. If Daniel was right, and he always is, it'll be another 150 years before that happens again. It's a long time. I was kinda wondering which direction home was."
"It's this way."
"No, I meant..."
"You will again. Loss is that way. I mourned my husband for a hundred days. I never left my house...I never spoke to anyone."
"After that?"
"You left this at home."
"Oh, Yeah. Yeah."
"Paynan has invited you to evening supper."
"Why? He doesn't even like me."
"He's very grateful for all the help you've given him in rebuilding his home."
"Still, you've worked very hard...thank you."
"Anything I can do."
"Yeah? What?"
"No...it's too soon."
"Now, come on...don't...do that...what?"
"You'll know when the time comes."
"Does that help?"
"Initiating beam firing sequence...now."
"Particle beam is operating at 112% of predicted efficiency."
"How long will the beam have to be maintained?"
"The longer, the better, sir. The important thing will be to dial again as quickly as possible as soon as it shuts down."
Edora. There is a party at Paynan's house. Jack is drinking with Paynan.
"So, what do ya think?"
"Absolute rotgut...more, please."
"What just happened?"
"The ancestors guided him to the one they wish him betrothed."
"He was peeking." "What?"
"What's happened?"
"Transmission interrupt at the source."
"Play back the visual...Whoa, there...see?"
"The gate is horizontal as you thought, Major Carter."

"...and the M.A.L.P. just slipped back through the event horizon. It means the vortex will have dug part way to the surface. Teal'c, you'll need to secure yourself above the event horizon as soon as you're on the other side and you'll have to carry everything you need."
Edora - Jack and Laira are entering Laira's house.
"Garan?"
"It's just us."
"Ah...well, apparently I should expect a massive headache tomorrow...so I should get a head start."
"Do you remember when I told you...there was something you could do for me?" "I want you to give me a child."
"Laira...you should know...a part of me is never going to let go of what I left behind."
"Well...that's not the part I want."
Edora - Paynan and Jack are chopping wood. Both have hangovers.
"She is a fine woman."
"Yes, she is."
"Took you long enough to see that...I was afraid you were going blind."
"Well, if I've gone blind...it's from whatever we were drinking last night."
"Tolka...has a bite to it."
"Eh...Yeah."
Buried Edoran Stargate - Teal'c is hooking himself to the ceiling of the cavern. The wormhole is still active.
"General Hammond...I have secured myself on the other side."
"Understood, Teal'c."
Outside Laira's House - Jack is sharpening a hatchet on a spinning stone. Laira comes out of the house carrying Jack's SGC stuff in a basket.
"Goin' somewhere with that stuff?"
"Well, hang on...some of that's pretty good...the jacket is, uh..."
"Does it remind you of home?"
"Are you sure?"
"Yeah."
Buried Edoran Stargate - Teal'c continues trying to drill to the surface.
"It is most difficult, Daniel Jackson."
"The 'gate will shut down automatically in ...60 seconds. At that point we won't be able to open it again from this side. The vortex would vaporize everything within the cavern."
"You'll have a maximum of four hours of oxygen once we're cut off. If you haven't reached the surface by that time..."
"You may want to wish me Ral Tora Ke..."
"Good luck, Teal'c."
Laira is at the water's edge starting to sort through Jack's things. She picks up his radio and messes with the dials...she hears Sam...
"15 seconds till shut down....10 seconds till shut down...5 seconds..."
Buried Edoran Gate - Teal'c is still dangling from the cavern ceiling...
Laira's House - evening meal.
"Curling...Big where my grandfather's from in, uh, Northern Minnesota. You throw a big round, kind of slab of rock down this...slab of ice and just sweep..." "What?"
"When I was taking your things away today...I thought I heard a sound come from this." "Perhaps a voice..."
Edorans arriving home and being greeted by those who stayed behind. Jack is standing in front of the other three members of SG-1. He is still in Edoran garments.
"So when the third M.A.L.P. sent back just a few seconds of telemetry, we knew the gate was horizton...tal...and..." "Is he all right?"
"He's fine...I just don't think he was expecting to go home again."
"No, I'm not."
"You don't have to..."
"Come with me..."
"I'll come back...soon...we still have that treaty to talk about..."
"Our two worlds are going to be...friends."
"Closer friends. Fair day and be well."
